head.title: Parade Ground Wins Again on Turf

hedline.hl1: Parade Ground Wins Again on Turf

abstract.p: Parade Ground wins Lawrence Realization at Belmont Park (S)

block.p: Parade Ground, sixth in the Kentucky Derby and fourth in the Belmont, continued to flourish since being switched to the grass, winning yesterday's $125,000 Lawrence Realization at Belmont for his third victory in four starts on the turf.
Confidently ridden by Pat Day, Parade Ground rallied along the inside on the far turn and then held off a late flurry from the 31-1 shot Pay Zone to win by a half-length in a stakes record 2:254

Parade Ground, sixth in the Kentucky Derby and fourth in the Belmont, continued to flourish since being switched to the grass, winning yesterday's $125,000 Lawrence Realization at Belmont for his third victory in four starts on the turf.
Confidently ridden by Pat Day, Parade Ground rallied along the inside on the far turn and then held off a late flurry from the 31-1 shot Pay Zone to win by a half-length in a stakes record 2:254
Parade Ground returned $3.40 for $2 to win as he earned $83,595 for the owner William S. Farish.
The trainer Neil Howard said he had not yet made plans for the colt's next start, but did not rule out the $2 million Breeders' Cup Turf on Nov. 7 at Churchill Downs.
